result.execSummary:
The defendant Damion Odel Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: (CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE), with credit for 5 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
As to all costs and surcharges, amounts to be deducted from bail on deposit.  Remaining balance to be returned to the person who posted it.

Obtain high school diploma or equivalent.
Maintain employment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No drugs or alcohol.
No new offenses.
Any additional conditions deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 120 DAYS in the House of Corrections.
- 60 DAYS in the House of Correction upfront with huber release for work, childcare and school (REPORT DATE: 6/3/16).
- 60 DAYS condition time (imposed and STAYED) to be used at the discretion of the agent.

Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Damion Odel Daniels in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  Based upon plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instruction received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms, body armor or ammunition.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Matter to be retained by Br. 35 (and not re-assigned per Chief Judge Directive 15-19).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damion Odel Daniels in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton (by phone).  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for plea hearing today.  Defense counsel is unable to appear personally today.  Additionally, Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct hearing today.  Matter is adjourned.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Exhibit 1 received and inventoried this date.
